thread.title: Three Killed in Blast at Natural Gas Plant in Louisiana
thread.title_full: Three Killed in Blast at Natural Gas Plant in Louisiana - WSJ

author: Alison Sider
title: Three Killed in Blast at Natural Gas Plant in Louisiana
text:
Three workers were killed in an explosion and fire Thursday at a natural gas plant in Gibson, La., according to Williams Partners LP, the company that owns the facility.
The plant, located 70 miles southwest of New Orleans, wasn’t operating at the time of the blast, the company said. The fire happened during maintenance work on a tank known as a “slug catcher,” which is designed to remove liquids and impurities from the natural gas... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
